intro: Chaenactis scaposa, commonly known as the slenderstalked paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its stems are slender and usually unbranched, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are yellow and occur in a dense cluster at the top of the stem, making it a distinctive and attractive wildflower.
